alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Panola; Rusk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Harrison, northern Panola and northeastern Rusk Counties through 1230 PM CST... At 1200 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tatum, or 15 miles southwest of Marshall, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marshall, Waskom, Tatum, Beckville, Deberry, Elysian Fields, Easton, Scottsville, Jonesville, Darco and Leigh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
